Package topdown

Class Enemy

  • java.lang.Object
    • topdown.GameObject
      • topdown.Enemy
  • public class Enemy
extends GameObject
    Class used to determine/set enemy properties before inserting them into the game.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Isaac Jimenez, Nicholas English, Suman Gurung

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Enemy​(int x, int y, Type type, Handler handle, Game game)
      Constructor creates an enemy object by accepting in various parameters needed to determine the properties of the enemy.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.awt.Rectangle getBounds()
      Returns the boundaries of the enemy based on its size as a rectangle.
      int getEnemySpeed()
      Returns an int that represents the speed of the enemy object.
      int getEnemyWait()
      Returns the integer value for the amount of time the current enemy object has been holding a direction.
      int getHealth()
      Returns an int that represents the current health of the enemy object.
      void render​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Draws the enemy based on it's size and color.
      void setEnemyDirection()
      Sets the direction for the enemy to move in.
      void setEnemySpeed​(Type type)
      Sets the enemy speed for the enemy object based on the enemy type.
      void setEnemyWait​(int wait)
      Sets the amount of time the current enemy object has been holding a direction.
      void setHealth​(int health)
      Sets the enemy health for the enemy object to the amount passed.
      void tick()
      Continuously updates the enemy position, and checks to see if the enemy has collided with a player's bullet.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Enemy

        public Enemy​(int x,
             int y,
             Type type,
             Handler handle,
             Game game)
        Constructor creates an enemy object by accepting in various parameters needed to determine the properties of the enemy.
        Parameters:
        x - represents the x coordinate at which the enemy will spawn.
        y - represents the y coordinate at which the enemy will spawn.
        type - represents the type of object.
        handle - represents the instance of the Handler class being passed down to this constructor.
        game - represents the instance of the Game class being passed down to this constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • setEnemyWait

        public void setEnemyWait​(int wait)
        Sets the amount of time the current enemy object has been holding a direction.
        Parameters:
        wait - The amount of time the enemy has been waiting.

      • getEnemyWait

        public int getEnemyWait()
        Returns the integer value for the amount of time the current enemy object has been holding a direction.
        Returns:
        The int value for the length of time the enemy has been waiting.

      • setEnemyDirection

        public void setEnemyDirection()
        Sets the direction for the enemy to move in.

      • getEnemySpeed

        public int getEnemySpeed()
        Returns an int that represents the speed of the enemy object.
        Returns:
        The speed of the current enemy object.

      • setEnemySpeed

        public void setEnemySpeed​(Type type)
        Sets the enemy speed for the enemy object based on the enemy type.
        Parameters:
        type - The enemy type of the current enemy object.

      • getHealth

        public int getHealth()
        Returns an int that represents the current health of the enemy object.
        Returns:
        The health of the current enemy object.

      • setHealth

        public void setHealth​(int health)
        Sets the enemy health for the enemy object to the amount passed.
        Parameters:
        health - The health to be set to the current enemy object.

        Continuously updates the enemy position, and checks to see if the enemy has collided with a player's bullet.
